Like, really?

Yeah, they will be doing more damage, but you will have more health overall and be harder to take down. 

Let's say you have 1k extra health with this change and a total health of 3k facing a Vayne. Her max rank bolts do 12% max health true damage. So with each hit she would be doing 60 health This will cause her to do 360 per silver bolt attack. So you would negate almost 3 of those attacks which would keep you alive a couple more seconds. 

While a couple seconds doesn't sound long, it really is pretty long in a teamfight and could easily swing the fight in your favor. Hopefully I explained it good enough to make sense.
I really don't think any amount of health really slows down how quickly Vayne can kill you.

Although vayne can get strong as heck late game with items, a little CC can stop her dead in her tracks. And I beleive that is where skill and mechanics come into play. Yeah a vayne vs a team who has no idea how to be sitautional in a team fight is  OP. But a vayne vs equally skilled players can be shut down.

Counters to vayne:

On a side note, while this has nothing to do with vayne counters but rather an interesting interaction with vayne: I was once playing {{champion:101}} and a vayne pulled up on me and i went to throw my stun just as she shot her condemn. Fortunately the condemn missed. This, however, fucked vayne over because her condemn increased the travel distance of my mid-cast stun, thus stunning her for much longer than it would have (I had been at 1x-2x melee distance at cast start) and this allowed enough time for me to cast q AND w, resulting in me killing her when i otherwise would have died very quickly (was retreating from a roam with ~1/4 hp). Had she not condemned at all, she would have easily killed me.
So I guess we can take away that, at least at shitter ELO i play at, sometimes the biggest vayne counter is the vayne player themselves.

>Her max rank bolts do 12% max health true damage.

This is the important part of this statement. Silver Bolts kills a target with infinite armour in 9 procs, regardless of their HP. HP is the least effective stat you can build into Vayne because it does absolutely nothing VS her Silver Bolts once you get past 1k HP.

The problem with that is % health damage is there to help guarantee that the champion is outputting some reliable damage and not becoming obsolete at a certain point in the game.

I'd like for resistances to mean a bit more personally. But they'd need to change the scaling of it so that it starts slightly weaker than now, but doesn't diminish quite as much, for example:

Say 30 armor currently is 24%, and 200 armor is a 60% damage reduction. (random numbers)
Change it to (again, random numbers)
30 armor equalling 22%, and 200 armor equalling 65% damage reduction.

The point being that champions that do stack armor wouldn't feel as obsolete once there's an LW variant out, whilst making sure that those buying one armor item wouldn't now be tankier than before, so that carries don't run rampant building tankier (lookin at you,{{champion:104}} )

Or Riot could just lower damage across the board slightly and make items not as effective for  damage and tankiness and utility at the same time, So that people might have to actually commit to one or the other.

Resistances don't actually diminish in the way you probably think. Every 1 point of armor or magic resist increases your effective HP by 1% against it's respective damage source.

Example: Champion with 1000 hp and 0 armor requires 1000 attack damage to kill.
Champion with 1000 hp and 100 armor requires 2000 attack damage to kill.
Champion with 1000 hp and 200 armor requires 3000 attack damage to kill.

This is all assuming no pen or regen.

The problem with this is that Vayne and Fiora are the two big offenders when it comes to %damage, generally other champs with %damage are good against tanks but lack the insane tank destruction of these two champs as tanks can counterbuild with armour or MR. Because these champs deal true damage any damage reduction is rendered ineffective against them.

What is actually needed IMO is a true damage counter outside of just raw HP. Just an item with a passive something like "converts 10% of physical and magic damage into a shield which blocks incoming true damage". This would give tanks an item to build into Fiora and Vayne which their kits don't just allow them to ignore.
i would say 15% considering the amount of %damage they can pull off

You have to balance around other cases too. If you set values too high then champs like Cho'gath and Olaf who rely on burst true damage would wind up suffering in a lot of cases. I also think the shield cap should be fairly low, probably around 20+10 per level so it would be a strong item vs sustained true damage without shutting out burst true damage.

You do realize it's called true damage because it can't be reduced...

There's a difference between reducing and absorbing. If you drop a Janna shield on somebody it will absorb true damage, it's different to reducing the damage, it's effectively giving you HP to tank it with.

I'm going to be honest here, I generally don't think true damage is a huge problem, I have no problem with characters like Cho'gath, Irelia, Olaf and Darius dealing true damage, all of these cases are fine because tanks can mitigate their damage by building more HP into them. Fiora and Vayne are the two cases of true damage which I feel need to be dealt with.

%HP true damage is a huge problem because there's absolutely nothing a tank can do against it. You can have invested 12K gold into your defences and they do absolutely nothing. 

I'd prefer if Riot just reworked Vayne and Fiora not to have %HP true damage on their kits so tanks could actually cope with them but that seems doubtful, so if they're not going to do that an item like this is the only way to give tanks some ability to be durable VS these champs.
